content.description:
Tackles the broken cracks at the far south (right) end of bughouse heights. Start on an awkward wide crack behind a large detached flake. Head up to an alcove, then out and left by way of underclinging and laybacking to the anchors. 
  
 Packs in a good variety of climbing on several nice features. Unfortunately it is not very consistent in difficulty or quality. Short, aesthetic cruxes are interrupted by easy scrambling up unappealing rock.  
  
 The book calls it 5.8 but I'm listing it as 5.9 based on my and my parters' experience and the spray on the web.

On the far right end of bughouse heights. It is the system of cracks immediately climber's left of the fixed lines up to left Penny Lane.
Good pro. Standard rack to 4", but you can fit a #5 camalot to keep you off the deck at the start.

A fun slabby climb. I found the crux to be at the top of the first block as the rock turns more vertical.

Looking at Skullduggery (the obvious off-width), this route is on the far left.  It is comprised of two large blocks.
5 blots. Found it tricky to start so put in a piece of gear and also put gear in the horizontal crack up near the top of the first block. this piece was pretty much all mental.  Anchors with chains at the top.

Chimney on right side of detached slab.  Follow right hand arete on the triangular wall above.

SR

The gaping crack.  The crux is first getting into the crack - a bolt protects here.  The unmistakable gaping wide crack at Bughouse Heights. A low-angle, shallow crack with marginal protection grants access to a comfortable ledge below the offwidth. Yes, it really goes at 5.10-.

It is pretty hard to miss the large off-width crack at Bughouse Heights. It's the humongous crack on the trail up to pixie corner.
Contrary to the guidebook description, this route is x-rated without at least one #6 and one #5 cam. The initial crack will take a 1" piece and something small (#2 c3). A bolt protects the first move into the squeeze. From here the crack runs from tipped-out #6 to #4. It is possible to place a #.75 to protect the final moves. Bolts with rap rings at the top

climbs.name: Sting in the Tail
climbs.fa: Dave Jones, R Miler, D. Hutchinson (1990)

content.description:
Climb the obvious crack in order to get to the upper block of slab above. Pull onto the block and climb the right bolt line on the slab above. The bolts on this slab are spaced fairly far apart.  
  
 The initial crack start is shared with the Tail Wind route.

Bughouse Heights Center
3 bolts, standard rack

climbs.name: Tail Wind
climbs.fa: Dean Hart, Dave Jones, Randy Atkinson (1990)

content.description:
Climb the obvious crack in order to get to the upper block of slab above. Pull onto the block and climb the left bolt line on the slab above. The bolts on this slab are spaced fairly far apart. 
  
 The initial crack start is shared with the Sting in the Tail route.

Bughouse Heights Center
Bolts, standard rack.

Follow the start crack on the slabby face for Too Pink to Think then branch left at the roof and climb through the Wide crack variation to the left. Psyched to scrape up your shins, bloody up your knees, fist some choss and sketch out on slightly runnout crumbly rock? Then boy oh boy is this the climb for you. Climbs the wide crack on the broken roof just left of Too Pink to Think on the wall by the scramble approach to Penny Lane.  The wall is just right on the path to Pixie Corner from the playground. If you hit the splitter offwidth of Skullduggery, then you've gone too far. Standard rack up to #4. You COULD bring a #5, but it'd likely just get in the way.

Follow the thin crack up the slab to the obvious broken roof. Jam and pull big moves between good holds. Solid gear can be found, you just have to look around. The wide crack variation over the roof to the left is Too Blue to Screw 12a Climbs the broken roof on the wall to climbers left of the hand lines up to Penny Lane.

Two routes to the left of Fata Morgana. The bolts mentioned in the Bourdon book have rightly been chopped. Standard rack up to hand sizes.
A nice, recently cleaned, cliff left of Penny Lane and right of Pixie Corner.  This area offers some shade and numerous climbs in a wide range of difficulties including a few hidden gems.
